page.title: 13CIDER FARM
page.content: Mr.Churchward has owned the farm for 38 years.It is a family concern employing seven people.The apples, picked from the orchards,are cruched in a mill to form a pulp.The pulp is spread three inches thick in a three foot square frame.It is wrapped in cheese cloth.Fourteen cheeses are placed on top of each other.They are then pressed using a hydraulic press _ one and a half tons per square inch. The juice then ferments in stainless steel or fibre glass tanks. Before cloth,straw was used and a screw press,turned by horses,was used instead of a hydraulic press. The cider is sold locally. Mr.Churchward has won many prizes for his cider. By Samantha,Ben,Antony,Matthew, Gareth,Samantha and Tomeaka.
